content: LONDON (Reuters Breakingviews) - Shire is gambling its AbbVie break fee on risky M&A. The Dublin-based pharma group has agreed to buy U.S. peer NPS to expand in lucrative rare drugs. The 51 percent premium is covered almost entirely by compensation from the collapse of Shire's sale to larger American rival AbbVie last year. That doesn't much mitigate the risk of doing a deal ahead of a key regulatory ruling.
name: Shire plc
title: Breakingviews: Shire gambles AbbVie break fee on risky $5 bln deal

content: LONDON Shire Plc has agreed to buy U.S. group NPS Pharmaceuticals Inc for $5.2 billion  the Dublin-based drugmaker's biggest acquisition yet as it seeks to strengthen  its position in the lucrative field of medicines for rare diseases.
name: Shire plc
title: Shire to buy NPS for $5.2 bln to boost rare disease drugs

content: * Indexes off: Dow 0.49 pct  S&P 0.55 pct  Nasdaq 0.41 pct   (Updates to market open)

title: US STOCKS-Wall Street falls as oil prices weigh on energy sector

title: US STOCKS-Wall Street set to open flat ahead of earnings
